title: Management of Orbital and Periorbital Venous Malformation
patient: A 15-year-old female with a VM affecting her left cheek and periorbital area (Figure A). The periorbital component was treated with surgical debulking elsewhere previously. MRI showed the VM within the left buccal space, extending into the temporal region, deep to the temporalis muscle (Figure B). ES of the VM was performed leading to marked improvement of the facial symmetry (Figure C). The residual VM over the lateral canthus was debulked and the residual lesion remained unchanged over 2 years (Figure D).
